quizzes.title: History Quiz: Absinthe and Chocolate
quizzes.description: Test your history knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering History, ground, content. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: When you serve absinthe, you pour it straight over a sugar cube, then add a small portion of water to the glass before tossing it down. After that, you should do this.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Light it up

questions.question: The Absinthe Drinker and Woman Drinking Absinthe are paintings that immortalise the fame of absinthe. Who is the artist that painted them?
Chocolate syrup was used as fake blood in the famous shower scene in the 1960 movie Psycho.
Chocolate is low in caffeine.
Does white chocolate contain cocoa solids?
The active ingredient of absinthe is thujone. It is chemically similar to this psychoactive substance. Scientists also believe that thujone and this substance affect the same brain receptors.
The mixture of hot cream and melted chocolate is called ganache. What does the French word ganache literally mean in English?
Absinthe was most popular in this country as it was the common beverage among artists and writers in the late 19th and early 20th centuries.
The alcohol content is very high in absinthe. It can be as high as this %.
Absinthe was prohibited in this year, because it was believed to be reason for elevated crime rates.

Addiction, hyper excitability, and hallucinations were believed to be manifestations of this syndrome, urged by absinthe. People considered that these traits, once acquired from absinthe drinking, became hereditary and could be passed over to their children.
Which Peanuts cartoon character said, All I really need is love, but a little chocolate now and then doesnt hurt!?
As the most ardent consumers of absinthe, the French produced these amounts in 1910, just for domestic use.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 36 million liters

questions.question: This delectable chocolate dessert is named after fungi rooted out of the ground by pigs.
The word absinthe comes from ancient Greek and means this.

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Blackjack and Player
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, signs, game. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: If you see the characters “S17” printed on a Blackjack table what valuable information do you get about the rules of the game in this casino?

options.text: Soft 17s are considered eights by the dealer

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The dealer stands on soft 17s

questions.question: In most U.S. casinos counting the cards even mentally is illegal.
What is the popular set of optimal rules for playing Blackjack called?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Basic strategy

questions.question: In Blackjack, it is crucial for the player not to let neither the dealer nor the other players see his/her cards.
This is what they call a straight shot of absinthe served over a cube of sugar.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Van Gogh Crazy

questions.question: In Blackjack what card combination is called Blackjack?

options.text: Any card combination with total value of 21
An ace and a card with value 10

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: An ace and a card with value 10

questions.question: If you play Blackjack with handheld cards in a casino, with which one of these non-verbal signs can you tell the dealer you want to “hit” (have one more card)?

options.text: Scrape the cards against the table
Slide the cards under the bet
Place additional chips on the top of the original bet
Place additional chips next to the original bet

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Scrape the cards against the table

questions.question: The popular casino game Blackjack is known under several different names. Which of the following is NOT one of them?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Crazy Eights

questions.question: What card combination is called “Soft 17” in Blackjack?

options.text: An ace valued 11 plus 6 more points from other cards
An ace valued 1 plus 16 more points from other cards

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: An ace valued 11 plus 6 more points from other cards

questions.question: Which of the following versions of Blackjack is most favorable to the player?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Single deck game

questions.question: In Blackjack how is it accepted for a player holding the cards in his/her hand to give a sign to the dealer he/she wants to stand (stay)?

options.text: By scraping the cards against the table
By sliding the cards under the bet
By placing additional chips next to the bet

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: By sliding the cards under the bet

questions.question: In the casino version of Blackjack, what is a “shoe”?

options.text: The edge of the playing table
The container from which cards are dealt
The container where the player puts the cards he/she receives
The shape of the playing table

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The container from which cards are dealt

questions.question: In casinos where Blackjack dealers must hit on soft 17 the game is substantially more favorable for the player than in casinos where dealers must stand on soft 17.
When the player “surrenders” in Blackjack, what part of his/her bet does he/she lose?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: One half

questions.question: The first written reference of Blackjack can be found in a short story by this world-famous author.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Miguel de Cervantes

quizzes.title: Knowledge Quiz: Calvin Klein and Blackjack
quizzes.description: Test your knowledge knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Knowledge, klein, kind. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Which one of these watch companies has produced luxury watches under the Calvin Klein brand?
In December 2002, Calvin Klein sold his company to which fashion corporation?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Phillips Van Heusen Corp.

questions.question: Which of these four Calvin Klein fragrances was created first in 1985?
The composition-dependant strategy works best in this kind of Blackjack game.
Calvin Klein won the Coty Award, the most prestigious award in fashion, in what three consecutive years?
This celebrity, then 15-year-old, starred in the controversial Calvin Klein underwear advertisement which featured the tagline nothing comes between me and my Calvins.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Brooke Shields

questions.question: In which U.S. city is the Blackjack Hall of Fame located?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: San Diego

questions.question: The first ever Calvin Klein collection featured what kind of clothes?
In April 2007 a new version of Blackjack was approved for playing in the U.S. state of Washington. What is it called?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Three Card Blackjack

questions.question: In Blackjack, what does a “natural” hand consist of?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ace and a ten-valued card

questions.question: What did American model and singer Mark Wahlberg advertise for Calvin Klein?
When is the so-called insurance offered to the player in Blackjack?

options.text: When the dealers exposed card is an ace
When the dealers exposed card is 10-valued

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: When the dealers exposed card is an ace

questions.question: Which one of these pairs of a model and a Calvin Klein fragrance, advertised by the model, is correct?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Kate Moss - Obsession

questions.question: Which of these is not a name of a Calvin Klein fragrance?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Dolce Vita

questions.question: When playing Blackjack in a casino, there are two proper ways to announce your decision after you’ve received a card – either say it aloud or use some of the commonly accepted non-verbal signs.

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Coffee and Sizes
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, coffee, world. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Which sizes are for those 5 4 - 5 5 tall, who have a higher bust and a shorter back?
What is a cappuccino?

options.text: Coffee plus aerated milk plus chocolate
Espresso plus aerated milk plus chocolate

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Espresso plus aerated milk

questions.question: Which dress sizes are for those who are 5 1 tall, with an average bust but a shorter back?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Junior Petite

questions.question: If a beverage has mocha in the name, what ingredients can you be sure that it contains?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Chocolate, coffee and milk

questions.question: Abrupt cessation of coffee consumption can cause caffeine-withdrawal headaches.
Which sizes are for those who are 5 2 - 5 3 tall, with a lower bust and a shorter back?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Half sizes

questions.question: A single shot (1 ounce) of espresso contains more caffeine than a 7-ounce cup of drip coffee.
What is the middle name of American fashion designer Calvin Klein?
In which part of the world was coffee first prepared as a beverage?
Most medical authorities believe that coffee consumption is harmful to the health.
Decaffeinated coffee contains no caffeine.
The consumption of coffee is forbidden by which one of the following religions?

options.text: The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints

questions.question: Which dress sizes are for those 5 2 - 5 3 tall, with an average bust but a shorter back?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Miss Petite sizes

questions.question: What is Latté?

options.text: Coffee plus aerated milk plus chocolate
Espresso plus aerated milk plus chocolate

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Espresso plus aerated milk

questions.question: Which of these countries exports the most coffee per year?

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Mall and Sizes
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, mean, world. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: This is the location of the oldest mall in England.
This is the location of the oldest mall still in use.
This is the location of the largest mall in Europe.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Istanbul, Turkey

questions.question: This is the largest mall in the North American continent.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The West Edmonston Mall

questions.question: Odd-numbered dress sizes are usually for younger women.
Misses sizes are cut more generously in the bust and hips than junior sizes.
This is the largest mall in the world, as of 2007.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The South China Mall

questions.question: The Berjaya Times Square Mall has 45 restaurants, its own theme park , and hip-hop town.  Where is it located?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Kuala Lumpur

questions.question: Half-sizes are for short-waisted women.
What does short-waisted mean?

options.text: It means your waist is shorter than your head.
It means your shorts need replacing.
It means your waist is not very high above the ground.
It means your torso is short.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: It means your torso is short.

questions.question: Petite sizes are for women who are under 5 1.
The mall in this city has its own 400-meter ski slope.
Plus sizes are for heavier women.
This is the largest mall in the USA.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The King of Prussia Mall

questions.question: This is considered to have been the first mall.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Isfahan Grand Bazaar

quizzes.description: Test your knowledge knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Knowledge, kind, dessert. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What type of meat is used in the preparation of the Indian dish called Bombay duck?

options.text: It is not tea, it is coffee

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Green tea

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Crying tiger

questions.question: What kind of meat product is used for the preparation of Buffalo wings?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Chicken wings

questions.question: The recipe for the German chocolate cake did not originate in Germany, but in this country.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: the USA

questions.question: What is the color of the blossoms of the apple tree?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: White and pink

questions.question: Which of these statements is true about the apple tree?

options.text: It grows up to 60 feet (18 meters).
Its crown is broad and dense.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Its crown is broad and dense.

questions.question: What type of dessert is the Boston cream pie?
He is considered the first architect whose fame was built on his mall designs.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Victor Gruen

questions.question: What type of meal is the Norwegian Omelette?

The Latin word for apple is malus, which is considered to be derived from the word malum. What does malum mean?
